drafting constituent correspondence

initiate community outreach projects
respond to in-person, written and telephone inquiries from constituents
make legislative and ceremonial presentations on behalf of Congresswoman Torres

ability to handle difficult situations with courtesy, tact and compassion
ability to exercise a high degree of initiative
ability to work independently and use good judgment
Knowledge of the cities, communities and issues of concern to the 35th Congressional District

key_responsibilities: work placement of stories in local district media
requirements: demonstrated experience working with various forms of media
Understanding of policy issues and ability to critically think of district implications

identifying emerging press opportunities

pitching stories and responding to press inquiries

scheduling and organizing press events

responsible for portions of the office's mail operation

comfortable with and show good judgment speaking on the record with press
ability to strategically connect DC policy with district press opportunities

Hill experience and Tennessee ties are a plus
knowledge of Judiciary and Transportation issues

execution of 499 program

office: Senior Member of Congress from the southern US

briefing the member and Chief of Staff on all policy matters
